snippet: The finance ministers of Japan and South Korea met on the sidelines of the International Monetary Fund and World Bank meetings in Tokyo in a bid to ease tensions over a territorial dispute.
abstract: Finance ministers of Japan and South Korea declare that their nations will closely cooperate on economic and financial issues, in talks aimed at limiting political damage from diplomatic clash over contested islands; talks take place during annual meetings in Tokyo of the International Monetary Fund and the World Bank
lead_paragraph: The finance ministers of Japan and South Korea met on the sidelines of the International Monetary Fund and World Bank meetings in Tokyo in a bid to ease tensions over a territorial dispute.

headline.seo: Japan and South Korea Vow Economic Cooperation During Talks
headline.main: Japan and South Korea Seek to Strengthen Economic Ties
